notes.text: Note: This condition is identified by complete loss of thrust accompanied by the following:
1. Loud bangs, knocks, vibration, or other noise, or
2. Engine Fire Indication (CAS Warning and/or FIRE light), or
4. Erratic engine indications, such as the following:
• Low or no N1 or N2
• High ITT, fuel flow, or oil temperature

steps.text: If message is displayed due to CAPS activation (pulling of CAPS Activation Handle):

• WARNING • Do not press and hold AP DISC Button if CAPS handle has been pulled; if handle has been pulled, parachute will deploy regardless and pressing AP DISC will prevent the aircraft from adequately slowing prior to deployment.

• CAUTION • Delay of AP DISC Button in response to an automatic flight control malfunction while manually overriding controls may result in excessive pitch out of trim condition.
CAUTION: Delay of AP DISC Button in response to an automatic flight control malfunction while manually overriding controls may result in excessive pitch out of trim condition.
If message is displayed but CAPS handle is NOT pulled:

• WARNING • CAPS AP mode will be unavailable for remainder of flight until next power cycle. If CAPS activation is necessary, the pilot must manually reduce airspeed below 135 KIAS and 145 KTAS, whichever is lower, to deploy the parachute.
Refer to Section 3: Emergency Procedures, 'CAPS Activation' procedure.

warnings.text: • WARNING • If a flat tire is suspected, do not retract landing gear since it may cause difficulties in extending the gear. Additionally, landings with the gear up are potentially more hazardous than with the gear down. The probability of aircraft damage is greater with gear up landings.

If a flat tire or tread separation occurs during takeoff and it is not possible to abort, land as soon as practicable. Tread separation could damage wing-mounted fuel system components. Continued flight could result in fuel imbalance or fuel exhaustion. A significant imbalance and/or exhaustion can result in loss of aircraft due to loss of control or loss of thrust leading to an off-airport landing.

steps.text: If main gear tire is flat:

steps.step:
a. Land on the side of the runway corresponding
 to the good tire.

b. Maintain directional control with the brakes,
 rudder, and aileron.

c. Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal
 Engine Shutdown.

steps.text: If nose gear tire is flat:

steps.step: a. Land in the center of the runway.
b. Hold the nosewheel off the ground as long as possible.

c. Do not taxi. Stop the airplane and perform a normal
 Engine Shutdown.

cautionAF.description: Auto fuel tank selection failure, use Manual mode.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • With increased idle speed, idle thrust will be greater than normal. To prevent overheating of brakes, exercise proper taxiing techniques.

cautionGZ.title: HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution
cautionGZ.description: Landing gear hydraulic power pack has overheated.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution CAS is accompanied by LDG GEAR FAIL Caution CAS:

steps.step: a. Refer to LDG GEAR FAIL Caution checklist.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution CAS is not accompanied by LDG GEAR FAIL Caution CAS:

steps.step:
b. Wait 2-3 minutes for HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT
 CAS message to extinguish.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT CAS message extinguishes:

steps.step: (1) Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist, as required.

steps.text: If HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT CAS message persists, power pack may still be operating continuously:

steps.step: (3) Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist, as required.

cautionGZ.description:
Engine IPS should be off, OR
Shutoff solenoid failed to close.

steps.text: If Engine IPS should be off:
If shutoff solenoid failed to close:

cautionGZ.title: IPS ENG INLET OVERHEAT Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Inlet temp higher than required for anti-ice, OR
Inlet temp higher than safe levels.

steps.step: c. Reduce thrust as necessary to extinguish message.

cautionGZ.title: IPS FLUID LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description: Less than 15 minutes of IPS fluid remaining.

cautionGZ.title: IPS WINDSHLD TIMER Caution
cautionGZ.description: Loss of WS/Rad pump automatic timer control.

cautionGZ.title: IPS WING/STAB FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Wing/Stabilizer IPS low system pressure, OR
Wing/Stabilizer IPS zonal pressure failure, OR
Wing/Stabilizer IPS controller failure, OR
Low system pressure, Wing/Stab IPS inoperative.

cautionGZ.title: IPS WING/STAB TEMP LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description: Min temp for boot operation is -40 °F.

cautionGZ.title: LDG GEAR FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Landing gear didn't reach the selected position.

steps.text: Note: Even though the gear assemblies are functioning properly, the root cause may be a failure of the gear sensors to indicate properly (Down/Up or Locked/Unlocked). Reversing the landing gear handle to the opposite position clears the inhibit of the hydraulic power pack enable (limited to 30 seconds of continuous operation).

steps.step: a. Monitor for HYDRAULIC OVERHEAT Caution.

b. Perform visual verification of gear position by ATC
 (towered airport), if possible.
c. Perform Alternate Gear Extension checklist.

cautionGZ.title: LDG GEAR SELECTOR FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Cannot determine landing gear selector position.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear is down:

steps.step: a. Do not cycle landing gear.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear is up:

steps.step: a. Select gear down as required.

steps.text: If message persists and landing gear does not extend:

steps.step: 1. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.

steps.text: CAUTION: Air restart may not be possible.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Air restart may not be possible.

notes.text: Note: Battery FAIL indicates an internal condition which reduces capability of the battery. Possible conditions include a faulty temperature sensor, disconnected heater, etc.

steps.step: b. Service aircraft as soon as practicable.
a. Exit IMC as soon as practicable.
b. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: CAUTION: Air restart may not be possible.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Air restart is not possible.

notes.text: Note: Battery FAULT indicates a condition causing battery to disable charging and/or discharging until corrected. Possible conditions include under-voltage, over-voltage, over-current, short-circuit, and over-temperature.

cautionGZ.title: MAIN BUS VOLTS Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Loss of forward main power bus voltage, OR
Main power bus voltage is low.

cautionGZ.title: NO ADC MODES Caution
cautionGZ.description: Autopilot air data modes are not available.

steps.text: Note: AP may only be engaged in pitch modes.

cautionGZ.title: NO VERT MODES Caution
cautionGZ.description: Autopilot vertical modes are not available.

steps.text: Note: AP may only be engaged in lateral modes.

cautionGZ.title: OIL FILTER BYPASS Caution
cautionGZ.description: Oil filter diff press too high, bypass impending.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN OFF Caution
cautionGZ.description: Oxygen has not been turned on.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN PASSENGER FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: Passenger oxygen valve has failed closed.

cautions.text: • CAUTION • Complete any emergency descent procedure prior to completing this checklist.

cautionGZ.title: OXYGEN PRESSURE LOW Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Oxygen pressure below regulator control (250 PSI), OR
Oxygen pressure low (500 PSI).

cautions.text: • CAUTION • If OXYGEN PAX CB is pulled, supplemental oxygen to the passengers will be unavailable.

cautionGZ.title: PITCH MET ACTIVE Caution
cautionGZ.description: Pitch manual electric trim is active.

steps.step: 1. Prepare for abnormal pitch movement upon AP disconnect.
2. Perform Pitch Trim Runaway / Failure Checklist.

cautionGZ.description: Starter will not disengage (start relay stuck).

cautionGZ.title: TAKEOFF EMER BAT Caution
cautionGZ.description:
Emergency battery (Bat 2) is not charged.
Emergency battery (Bat 2) is cold.

cautions.text:
• CAUTION •
Engine operating costs are predicated on a maximum of 2 minutes of takeoff thrust on an average flight. Exceeding 5 minutes of takeoff thrust may disproportionately increase engine operating costs. Time at takeoff thrust is limited to 5 minutes maximum, beginning when the thrust lever reaches the T/O thrust detent.

steps.text: NOTE: TCV will typically fail open resulting in colder than normal cabin temperatures. In the unlikely event that the TCV does not open upon failure, duct air temperature may be higher than desired and DUCT OVERHEAT Caution may occur.
If message persists and cabin temperature is warmer than acceptable:

steps.step: d. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: If message persists and cabin temperature is colder than acceptable:

steps.action:
DESCEND TO WARMER OUTSIDE
 AIR TEMPERATURE,
IF PRACTICAL

steps.step: b. Land as soon as practicable.

steps.text: NOTE: Autothrottle functions, including thrust lock, will be unavailable. CAPS activation will require manual retard of thrust lever to IDLE.

cautionGZ.title: WOW FAIL Caution
cautionGZ.description: WOW is indicating on ground state.

steps.step: a. Limit flaps to 0% or 50% in landing configuration.
b. Perform Flaps Inoperative Approach/Landing checklist.

c. Avoid any unnecessary maneuvers during flight.
 Limit maneuvers only to those necessary to safely
 land the aircraft.

steps.text: CAUTION: At 25% N2, ensure positive N1 indication. Be prepared to abort start. If any of the following occur, abort start:

• ITT exceeds limits (red line).

• No N1 indication by 25% N2.

• No evidence of lightoff within 8 seconds.

• Low oil pressure after start.
Note: The BLEED switch should not be set to BLEED until BAT 1 and BAT 2 have been ON for 2 minutes or more.
Caution: If TT2 heat FAIL Caution occurs with Engine IPS On, dispach is not allowed.
Note: Turn Engine IPS ON if OAT is less than or equal to 41F 95c) with visible moisture or visibility of less than 1 mile.

normalProcedures.title: IPS Activation
normalProcedures.description: OAT ≤ 41 °F (5 °C) with visible moisture or visibility less than 1 mile

steps.text: • WARNING • Ice contamination of the lifting surfaces may result in an inoperable or inadequate stall warning, which may cause an inadvertent stall. The resulting stall may lead to loss of control of the airplane. The WING/STAB IPS switch must remain at the ON position until the entire wing is free of ice accretion and ice is no longer accreting on the aircraft. Stall Warning offset must remain ON until entire airframe is free of ice.

Note: The left wing leading edge is the primary reference area for determining if ice is accumulating on the aircraft. Ice may be visible on other areas of the aircraft as well, such as the forward windshield.

steps.step: a. Contact ATC and notify of non-RVSM status.

steps.text: Note: Verify STALL SPEED HIGH CAS Advisory is present.
